intro: Esenbeckia berlandieri subsp. acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco esenbeckia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. It is typically found in dry to moist forests and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
